t: For the choir director. A psalm of David.
God,*pn hear my voice when I am in anguish. Protect*ln my life from the terror of the enemy.
Hide*ln me from the scheming of wicked people, from*ln the mob of evildoers,
who*ln sharpen their tongues like swords and*ln aim bitter words like arrows,
shooting*ln from concealed places at the blameless. They*ln shoot at him suddenly and are not afraid.
They*ln adopt an evil plan; they*ln talk about hiding traps and say, “Who*ln will see them?”
They*ln devise crimes and say, “We*ln have perfected a secret plan.” The*ln inner man and the heart are mysterious.
But*pn God will shoot them with arrows; suddenly,*ln they will be wounded.
They*ln will be made to stumble; their*ln own tongues work against them. All*ln who see them will shake their heads.
Then*ln everyone will fear and*ln will tell about God’s work, for*ln they will understand what he has done.
The*pn righteous one rejoices in the Lord*s and*ln takes refuge in him; all*ln those who are upright in heart will*ln offer praise.
